skill.name: Plugin Settings
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks about "plugin settings", "store plugin configuration", "user-configurable plugin", ".local.md files", "plugin state files", "read YAML frontmatter", "per-project plugin settings", or wants to make plugin behavior configurable. Documents the .claude/plugin-name.local.md pattern for storing plugin-specific configuration with YAML frontmatter and markdown content.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks about "plugin settings", "store plugin configuration", ...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: Official skill from a trusted source with documentation and examples. No executable payloads beyond illustrative shell scripts.

content.user_title: Configure plugin settings with local files
content.value_statement: You need per project plugin settings that users can edit safely. This skill shows a local markdown pattern with YAML frontmatter and parsing steps.
actual_capabilities: Show bash patterns to extract YAML frontmatter
Provide quick exit and enabled flag patterns
Offer settings file templates and gitignore guidance
Explain atomic update techniques for settings files
limitations: Does not execute hooks or scripts on disk
Does not provide full YAML parsing beyond simple fields
Settings changes require a Claude Code restart
Assumes standard bash tools like sed and awk

use_cases.title: Add configurable behavior
use_cases.description: Create a per project settings file so users can enable or tune a plugin without editing code.

use_cases.title: Coordinate agent tasks
use_cases.description: Store agent assignment and status in a local file that hooks can read for coordination.

use_cases.title: Gate risky writes
use_cases.description: Use enabled flags and strict modes to block sensitive paths in hooks.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic settings
prompt_templates.scenario: New plugin needs a local config file
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal .claude/my-plugin.local.md template with enabled and mode fields and a short markdown body.

prompt_templates.title: Parse frontmatter
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a bash snippet that extracts YAML frontmatter and reads enabled and strict_mode fields safely.

prompt_templates.title: Validate settings file
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a bash checklist to validate markers, non empty frontmatter, and boolean fields.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced update pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to update a single field in a settings file using a temp file and atomic move.

output_examples.input: Give me a safe pattern for plugin settings in Claude Code
output: Create `.claude/my-plugin.local.md` with YAML frontmatter and a markdown body.
Add an `enabled: true` flag and any mode fields you need.
Parse frontmatter with `sed` and `grep` in hooks or commands.
Restart Claude Code after changes so settings reload.

best_practices: Apply a quick exit when the settings file is missing or disabled
Use atomic temp file updates to avoid corruption
anti_patterns: Hardcoding absolute paths to settings files
Updating files in place with non atomic `sed -i`
Using unquoted variables when reading settings

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code on all platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, it applies to any Claude Code project that can read `.claude/*.local.md` files.

faq.question: What are the limits of the settings format?
faq.answer: Examples cover simple fields; complex YAML needs a tool like yq.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with hooks and commands?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples show usage in hooks, commands, and agents.

faq.question: Are settings files safe to share or commit?
faq.answer: They should be gitignored and kept local to the project.

faq.question: Why do changes not take effect immediately?
faq.answer: Claude Code must be restarted for hooks to reload settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to environment variables?
faq.answer: Settings files are per project and readable, while env vars are per shell and harder to track.
